website_summaries.verdict: With the D-Link DHP501-AV Powerline AV 500 Adapter Starter Kit you can turn an ordinary electrical outlet into a wired Gigabit Ethernet port. Youâ€™ll get fast transfer speeds with this kit, and itâ€™s easy to install, but the adapterâ€™s bulky design can be problematic.

customer_reviews.title: good solution but will not achieve the advertised speed.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good alternative to wireless. I am concerned about security and wanted to physically attach all my devices. While this does work, it does not achieve the desired speeds as advertised. I think the only way this is possible is if all of your circuits are on the same run. It it goes through a circuit box then the speed is greatly decreased. Also note that this can not be behind a battery backup, surge protector, GFCI circuit, or any other protective device or it will not work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Fox: Fairly Unbalanced

customer_reviews.title: D-Link PowerLine AV 500 Adapter Kit
customer_reviews.text: This product has worked flawlessly since about 20 minutes after I opened the package. The installation instructions are straight forward and work. This was my first experience with running a hard wired ethernet system through house wiring so I had my doubts about the process. It has worked like a charm. I run Netflix on my LG 47 inch flatscreen through this with minimal problems. I think I could move the adapter that my BD-220 LG Blu-Ray player plugs into to any recepticle in the house re-establish a connection to the sending unit by the router by pushing the button on the side of the unit and I would be good to go. Nice product.
customer_reviews.author: frederick r welsh

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well ..
customer_reviews.text: This product does not get 5 stars because it would not work in the same configuration as an old netgear powerline unit. The throughput is much better, on it, 500mbps vs 65, BUT it would not extend the network nearly as far as the one would. Ended up going back to the old one at my client's location and now using the d-link model at home where it works great, much faster than the wireless extender I was using before, 4x the speed! I was transferring files between computers at 1mb/s or less. now it is around 4mb/s or greater, hit almost 7mb/s.
customer_reviews.author: RyBan

customer_reviews.title: Way better than wireless
customer_reviews.text: These things rock. I'd give a big, long, technical review, but it's really not necessary. I usually speedtest my internet at ~80Mbps down at my router, but I needed a way to get those same speeds on the opposite side of my apartment, in my room, without running an ethernet cable across floor. Plug these in, connect your ethernet cables, and they just work. I get the same download speed to the router as I do in my room and it's MUCH faster, and more consistent, than Wireless N or G. Streaming 10+GB media files across the apartment via wireless just wasn't cutting it, and this solved my problems.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea, But Didn't Work For Me
customer_reviews.text: I did the setup and confirmed that the two outlets were on the same side of the breaker box, but after several attempts, it became obvious that the adapters were slowing down the entire wired network. When plugged in, the green power light was on, but the signal strength light was constantly blinking amber, and the network traffic light was also constantly blinking, which was somewhat annoying. Plugged into the back of a Panasonic plasma panel, it would be inconsistent in connecting to the VieraCast server, sometimes it would, but mostly it would fail.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ichiyama

customer_reviews.title: Right Device, Save Money
customer_reviews.text: My house is a 2-story with new HI-TECH appliances interferance and its very hard to extend my network to other Desktop Computer. I am totally happy I found this Device that Delivers a Superb Job of transferring HD-VIDEO and NO DROP SIGNAL,DEAD SPOTS to worry. I am definitely recommending this amazing device. THANKS D-Link and AMAZON its a SMART BUY!
customer_reviews.author: ED

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: After about 1 month after the DHP-501AV kit arrived, it works. As with my review of the D-Link PowerLine AV Network Adapter Kit (DHP-307AV), the units are so big that they'll occupy both sockets of a typical 2 socket outlet. I knocked off a star for this slight problem. My solution to this to buy a socket adapter with a flat top and two prongs. This adapter also serves as brace to keep the rather large units properly seated in its socket as well as allowing a powerstrip or surge protector to access the bottom socket. The DHP-501AV kit is compatible with the aforementioned, not to mention slower, DHP-307AV kit.
customer_reviews.author: cryingday

customer_reviews.title: PowerLine AV Adapter by D-Link
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the easiest way to extend your home or small business network. D-Link PowerLine adapters use your electrical house wiring to move your data. The powerline adapters move data faster than wireless networks, and work great with music and video streaming services.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Holiday

customer_reviews.title: They work like a charm
customer_reviews.text: They work like a charm. When I had a small problem with my first ones they immediately made it good by sending me a replacement pair. I would recommend these sellers to everyone as they stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: D-Link PowerLine AV 500 Adapter Kit (DHP-501AV)
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea, but hasn't been able to try them. To use them I had to be on the same electric fuse in the condo. I did not know that until I got them. So they are returned without using them. I bought an D-link extender instead, that works very well.
customer_reviews.author: LinL

customer_reviews.title: Easy and works great
customer_reviews.text: As simple as plugging it in. I will never struggle with whole home wifi again. I stressed over the purchase at first. I was worried that there was a special base unit needed to plug the internet into the power grid. Turns out the same simple unit will pull/push the internet from the wall depending on if it's connected to the internet source or a device like a computer. Couldn't be a simpler plug and play experience.
customer_reviews.author: edward

customer_reviews.title: Works OK, not as fast as I needed them ...
customer_reviews.text: Works OK, not as fast as I needed them to be. Adding a 3rd node seems to slow speed times down substantially.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: It really does work.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you read the directions. Plug both units into the wall in the same room until they are synced. DO NOT plug them into power strips or extension cords. Read the directions and plug them directly into the wall socket, and you will be pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Madden's mama

customer_reviews.title: D-Link PowerLine Adapter AV500
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to setup, took less than 5 minutes. I've used this for over a year now without any problems. One is connected to my router and the other connected to my AV Receiver. Have no complaints, Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: rawr its alan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fix for streaming tv
customer_reviews.text: Wireless router was in our upstairs bedroom. signal strength to the tv in the dens was low. shows often paused. the adapter greatly improved the signal strength.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Slower than I expected + drops in connection
customer_reviews.text: The speeds I've seen using these are much slower than I needed. I'm using these to mostly stream HD video. It works sometimes, but it becomes choppy and unusable for blu-ray streaming. I also find that it drops the connection at random intervals. For example, it kills my xbox connection probably on average of once every 6 hours of use. It becomes very frustration when watching hulu or netflix. It is possible its my house that's the issue, although I've tried multiple outlets and my home is only 8 years old. Nothing will beat a wired Ethernet network solution. I just wish these had been better so I don't have to wire my house.
customer_reviews.author: Eric H

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I needed this for routing internet from my router to my home office. It's easy to setup and the connection is decent. Not as good as direct link, obviously, but very good speed still.
customer_reviews.author: HL

customer_reviews.title: Worked just sometimes.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement for wireless extender, but gave up after it was failing 80% of the time. Maybe when neighbors were using something electrical or who knows why. Initial install was fine, was getting "green" connection, but then for no apparent reason would go to "yellow", then "red". And never got advertised connection speed, even when "green".
customer_reviews.author: Igor Razumeiko

customer_reviews.title: Great Coupled with Apple TimeCapsule or Airport
customer_reviews.text: Setup throughout 4-story townhouse and connectivity is excellent. One issue, which many have mentioned is the need to have its own outlet otherwise it degrades localized performance.
customer_reviews.author: Frank R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy breezy!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic pair! I unboxed them plugged them on and that was that... it worked.
customer_reviews.author: S. Napier

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: They do work pretty well once I was able to get them synced. I do notice that on the 2nd device the home light flashes amber at times, but since it is a gig ethernet, I can see why since the device connecting is the Xbox and it only runs at 100 MB.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K. Hazen

customer_reviews.title: it works better than the others
customer_reviews.text: Tried a few other ways to boos signal. This one worked the best and not bad price either. will add to system,
customer_reviews.author: roxanne00

customer_reviews.title: D-Link PowerLine AV 500 Adapter Kit (DHP-501AV)
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set of D-Link Powerline adapters that I have purchased and will continue to buy more as needed. A great way to extend your wired network without running additional wiring. I just finished pairing one to the master and am using it to provide high speed wired connections to my my TV, DVD Player, audio receiver and a Roku. The output from this adapter goes to a D-Link 5-Port Gigabit Desktop Switch (DGS-1005G). The additional four ports on the switch provide the connections to the components listed above. I have had no problems with these adapters. Switching from wireless to wired has made a big difference in streaming to my components.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have weak wifi signals and were never able to stream movies from anyplace in the house. We tried this and it works perfectly. In fact, it works so well, we bought more for other places.
customer_reviews.author: gina1230

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: The adapters worked as described. I've had problems with my wifi network in the past. So i got these as a backup for 1 room. The only issue I've had is that they heat up alot.
customer_reviews.author: Fauji

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these two powerline adapters and have had no problems since, now my house has excellent internet speeds where ever an outlet is available. I have not had any issues crossing over phases, connections are stable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good product... wish it was smaller
customer_reviews.text: easy to set up. works well. wish it was a tad smaller. It covers up multiple plugs without having an outlet itself. However, for the price... good deal
customer_reviews.author: A. F. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Works but is lacking
customer_reviews.text: Works but the through put is lacking... There is not enough Documentation on what the household Wire requirements should be for top performance. It does work well for low bandwidth needs
customer_reviews.author: Jeff November

customer_reviews.title: Met my Needs
customer_reviews.text: Worked just as advertised. Plug-in-play, Easy set up. However, no instructions on adding additional adaptor, and had to figure out on my own how to make addition, but it wasn't too difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Upshur

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, great product
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly in my apartment, setup was quick and easy. Speeds are much faster than my wireless connection. Very satisfied with this adaptor. Worked very well for my xbox.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Met expectation
customer_reviews.text: It does make a difference in signal strength based on electrical outlet utilized. Recommend trying several available outlets for better signal strength.
customer_reviews.author: CLG

customer_reviews.title: Internet Bandwidth Restored
customer_reviews.text: I bought this adapter in the hopes of increasing internet bandwidth to my upstairs area. Expectations exceeded. Now I can easily do everything upstairs on the internet that I used to only do in the basement.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Only get about 5Mbps on average speed through this...
customer_reviews.text: According to Speedtest.net I have a 162Mbps connection into my home router via Comcast. On my computer connected through the AV500 I have a 12Mbps connection today, it was only at 3Mbps yesterday. And I typically average 5 to 6 so I don't know why it's so (good...?) today. The speed light (in the middle) is pretty much RED all the time. Router is upstairs and my computer is downstairs. I've purchased a lot of D-Link products over the years but sorry to say this one pretty much sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy!
customer_reviews.text: By far the easiest install ever. True Plug and Play for connectivity! I was up and running in less than 2 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Ric C. Ruhlman

customer_reviews.title: 2 light weight bookends
customer_reviews.text: I bought these tiny bits of wonder and they have never worked from day one! Never will I waste any more of my money on D-Link anything again!
customer_reviews.author: ellenaustin

product_meta.title: D-Link PowerLine Adapter AV500 Gigabit Mini Starter Kit (DHP-501AV)
product_meta.description: Blazing speeds and wired connectivity anywhere in the house, makes this PowerLine AV 500 Adapter Starter Kit ideal for high-bandwidth network-ready devices. The D-Link PowerLine AV 500 Adapter Starter Kit comes with 2 PowerLine AV 500 Adapters (DHP-500AV) and uses electrical wiring already in your house to provide fast, reliable speeds of up to 500Mbps.Simply connect one adapter to a power outlet and your router, and then plug the second adapter into another outlet to get instant network connections. Once the devices are plugged in, press the simple connect button on each device to establish a safe, secure connection.
feature_bullets: Gigabit port for connecting high speed devices
Use Your home’s electrical wiring by plugging into existing power outlets
Backward Compatible with HomePlug AV devices
Gigabit port for connecting high speed devices
Use Your home’s electrical wiring by plugging into existing power outlets
Backward Compatible with HomePlug AV devices
Supports 128-bit AES Encryption for Network Security
QoS Support Helps Prioritize Internet Traffic

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars79 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
